com.blahti.drag

Interface DropTarget

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DragLayer

    public interface DropTarget
    Interface defining an object that can receive a view at the end of a drag operation.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean acceptDrop(DragSource source, int x, int y, int xOffset, int yOffset, DragView dragView, java.lang.Object dragInfo)

      Handle an object being dropped on the DropTarget

    • Method Detail

      • onDrop

        void onDrop(DragSource source,
            int x,
            int y,
            int xOffset,
            int yOffset,
            DragView dragView,
            java.lang.Object dragInfo)
        Handle an object being dropped on the DropTarget
        Parameters:
        source - DragSource where the drag started
        x - X coordinate of the drop location
        y - Y coordinate of the drop location
        xOffset - Horizontal offset with the object being dragged where the original touch happened
        yOffset - Vertical offset with the object being dragged where the original touch happened
        dragView - The DragView that's being dragged around on screen.
        dragInfo - Data associated with the object being dragged

      • acceptDrop

        boolean acceptDrop(DragSource source,
                   int x,
                   int y,
                   int xOffset,
                   int yOffset,
                   DragView dragView,
                   java.lang.Object dragInfo)
        Check if a drop action can occur at, or near, the requested location. This may be called repeatedly during a drag, so any calls should return quickly.
        Parameters:
        source - DragSource where the drag started
        x - X coordinate of the drop location
        y - Y coordinate of the drop location
        xOffset - Horizontal offset with the object being dragged where the original touch happened
        yOffset - Vertical offset with the object being dragged where the original touch happened
        dragView - The DragView that's being dragged around on screen.
        dragInfo - Data associated with the object being dragged
        Returns:
        True if the drop will be accepted, false otherwise.

      • estimateDropLocation

        android.graphics.Rect estimateDropLocation(DragSource source,
                                           int x,
                                           int y,
                                           int xOffset,
                                           int yOffset,
                                           DragView dragView,
                                           java.lang.Object dragInfo,
                                           android.graphics.Rect recycle)
        Estimate the surface area where this object would land if dropped at the given location.
        Parameters:
        source - DragSource where the drag started
        x - X coordinate of the drop location
        y - Y coordinate of the drop location
        xOffset - Horizontal offset with the object being dragged where the original touch happened
        yOffset - Vertical offset with the object being dragged where the original touch happened
        dragView - The DragView that's being dragged around on screen.
        dragInfo - Data associated with the object being dragged
        recycle - Rect object to be possibly recycled.
        Returns:
        Estimated area that would be occupied if object was dropped at the given location. Should return null if no estimate is found, or if this target doesn't provide estimations.
